p: Sialidase activities of influenza virus strains are also known to have differences in low-pH stability in an acidic environment (pH 4.0–5.0) [ 51]. A/Puerto Rico/8/1934 and A/Memphis/1/1971 lost sialidase activity in an acidic condition of pH 4.0, while the activity of these two strains was stable even at 56°C ( Fig 2). It is speculated that the steric structure of the influenza neuraminidase protein is affected by different mechanisms in low-pH and high-temperature conditions.
